title: Applying design research methodology for online visualization education: Integration of DSLM and service-learning

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental data visualization comprehension and educational design principles knowledge
context.additional_context: Applying visualization education methodologies for pre-service teachers in limited tech environments (smartphone-centric), operating with formative assessment focus

learning_goals: Utilizing the DSLM framework, learners can independently conduct a visualization design research process within 14 weeks
Through service-learning (S-L) integrated projects, learners experience transforming community issues into visualization solutions

Learners can lead a large-scale online design study with 10+ participants using LMS-based collaboration tools (e.g., Google Workspace, Microsoft Teams), achieve a weekly learning goal completion rate of 80% or higher over four weeks, and receive a participant satisfaction survey score of 4.0/5.0 or higher.

Learners can create two visualization prototypes based on customer interaction scenarios using smartphone-optimized tools like Figma or Adobe XD, incorporate feedback from peers/instructors (5+ items), and submit an improved version reflecting 80% or more of the feedback.
Learners can reconstruct design research outcomes into teachable materials applicable to educational settings

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
